item.title: Graphs are everywhere
item.description: If you pay attention to everything around you, you will notice that graphs are everywhere. It is natural to represent many things as graphs. For example, a social network can be represented as a graph where the nodes are people and the edges are friendships. Graph Neural Network (GNN) is a neural network that can learn from graph structure. It can be used for many tasks such as classifying nodes, predicting the connection between nodes, or predicting the graph structure.
